article: We all know how important it is to teach our dogs basic life lessons, but are you open to the life lessons your dog can teach you? I often consider myself to be a(n) _ dog owner.When my husband and I adopted our dog,Daisy, I vowed to give her the best life possible,and I've done my best to keep that _ . However, it hasn't always been _ . We've battled behavioral issues and health problems, _ we find ways to make it work.Through it our bond has gotten stronger, and I can _ say she has taught me a few things along the way. When I started working as a freelance writer two years ago,my lifestyle _ .As my workload _ , I began spending less and less time outside of the house. Then, one day while I was _ writer's block, Daisy insisted I take her outside to play. I fought her at first because I needed to work, but _ gave in. After about an hour of playing, we came back inside, and I found myself clear-headed and ready to _ . I learned my lesson from her: A little fresh air goes a long way to _ your day. Last summer, I was very _ . I found myself working from the time I got up right up until bedtime, which left little time for Daisy. It's not that I was _ her needs, but just that I didn't have as much time to devote to her as I once did. It wasn't until I started seeing changes in her _ that I realized there was a problem. She wasn't following my commands, so I started searching for the _ . As it turned out she needed more _ from me, and when I made more time for her,things went back to _ . She showed me that even when I'm up to my ears in work, I have to make time to spend _ my loved ones.
